channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Horrific shredded litter, 14th July
item.description:
The entire stretch of the A417 from Zoons Court roundabout to Churchdown Hamburger roundabout is covered in shredded litter and debris from the recent grass cutting. It's an absolute disgrace. This should have been litter picked before. Everything from litter to traffic cones and plastic car debris has been shredded both sides of the carriageway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 90 Lavington Drive, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water pouring from a broken upright pipe, 14th July
item.description:
I believe this was broken by the recent grass cutting. Pressurised water is pouring from the pipe. It is located on the traffic lights crossroads if the A417 Gloucester Business Park and Hucclecote Road. It's on the corner by the bridge heading to Brockworth from the bypass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree stump moving, 14th July
item.description:
Glencairn Park Road, close to turning into Glencairn Court. Tall stump of old tree is now loose / coming out of pavement (suspect it's been hit by a vehicle). Remnants of tree need removing, and then pavement needs to be made good.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 15 Glencairn Court Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree blocking pavement, 14th July
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road (approx. opposite junction with Shelburne Road). Between pedestrian crossing and end of railway bridge parapet. Overhanging tree is totally blocking pedestrian part of path, forcing pedestrians into cycle lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Lansdown Castle Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak on Gloucester Road near the junction of Libertus, 13th July
item.description:
Water leak on Gloucester Road near the junction of Libertus. Can somebody pass this on to 7 Trent please

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parts of car dumped, 13th July
item.description:
I think this is classed as fly tipping parts of a car on the grass on Buckingham avenue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8a Buckingham Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very pronounced trip hazard, 13th July
item.description:
Although paving slabs are often out of alignment, this particular one of Vittoria Walk in Cheltenham (Town end - almost opposite the YMCA) is very raised and a potential trip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Oriel House Oriel Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 13th July
item.description:
Bits of refuse, plastic sacks, etc. have been dumped on the side of the road, please could they be cleaned up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud and gravel in road, 13th July
item.description:
Mud & gravel repeatedly builds up on the side of the road by a bank and spills into the road. Causes vehicles to pull out further into the road, particularly dangerous as we are just approaching a bend. Can this be sorted please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grasses obscuring view of road, 13th July
item.description:
Hello - could the council please cut the grass on this verge? It has grown so high it is obscuring the view of the road when you turn out of the junction and is posing a danger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A435, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 13th July
item.description:
The litter bins on the playing field by the Old Patesians club are overflowing and have been for several days. I am not sure who is responsible for emptying these but they need sorting urgently. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Southfield Approach, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and shopping trolley dumped., 12th July
item.description:
Russell Street no 12

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Townsend Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Lights need removing, 12th July
item.description:
These were put up a couple of weeks ago when something was flytipped on the side of the road. This was quickly removed so the traffic lights don't appear to be serving any purpose now, other than delaying traffic and increasing pollution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 A435, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in pavement, 11th July
item.description:
Queens Road - few metres from exit from railway station car park. Close to brick wall with railings on top. Hole in tarmac pavement - looks to be a void below pavement surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 71 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Road Surface, 10th July
item.description:
The road surface between the main road and the turn off to Wigmoor to is in very poor condition. A serious accident occurred here today when a cyclist came off his bike as a result of this requiring the attendance of the emergency services. This accident would of been avoidable if the surface had been maintained.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Haydon Stoke Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
